00045 template <class T>
00046 class UnaryPlus: public plus<T> {
00047  public:
00048   UnaryPlus(const T& x) {
00049     plusConst = x;
00050   }
00051   T operator()(const T& x) {
00052     return x + plusConst;
00053   }
00054   T plusConst;
00055 };
00056 
00057 template <typename ArgType, typename ResultType = ArgType>
00058   class UnaryMultiplies: public unary_function<ResultType, ResultType> {
00059  public:
00060   UnaryMultiplies(const ArgType& x) {
00061     multConst = x;
00062   }
00063   ResultType operator()(const ResultType& x) {
00064     // the cast to double is to force "operator*(sat_int16,double) to be used.
00065     return (ResultType) (double(x) * double(multConst));
00066   }
00067   ArgType multConst;
00068 };
00069 
00070 template <class T>
00071 class UnaryDivides: public divides<T> {
00072  public:
00073   UnaryDivides(const T& x) {
00074     divConst = x;
00075   }
00076   T operator()(const T& x) {
00077     return x / divConst;
00078   }
00079   T divConst;
00080 };

00082 template <class RAIterator>
00083 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type
00084 max_value(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00085   return *max_element(start, stop);
00086 }
00087 
00088 template <class RAIterator>
00089 void ratio(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00090   UnaryMultiplies<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type> div(1 / *start);
00091   transform(start, stop, start, div);
00092 }

00094 template <class Container>
00095 Container & 
00096 difference(Container & first, Container & second) {
00097   transform(first.begin(), first.end(), second.begin(), first.begin(), minus<typename Container::value_type>());
00098   return first;
00099 }

00101 template <class RAIterator>
00102 class Ratio: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>  {
00103  public:
00104   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type denominator;
00105   Ratio(typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type x): denominator(x) {};
00106   void operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00107     transform(start, stop, start, UnaryMultiplies<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>(1/denominator));
00108   };
00109 };

00111 template <class RAIterator>
00112 class Add: public binary_function<RAIterator, RAIterator, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>  {
00113  public:
00114   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type constant;
00115   Add(typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type x): constant(x) {};
00116   void operator()(RAIterator start, RAIterator stop) {
00117     transform(start, stop, start, UnaryPlus<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator>::value_type>(constant));
00118   };
00119 };

00121 template <class RAIterator1, class RAIterator2>
00122 typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type
00123 scalar_product(RAIterator1 start1, RAIterator1 stop1, RAIterator2 start2 ) {
00124   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type sum = 0;
00125   for (;start1 < stop1; start1++, start2++) {
00126     sum += *start1 * *start2;
00127   }
00128   return sum;
00129 };
00130 
00131 template <class Container1, class Container2>
00132 Container1 insert(Container1 into, Container2 from) {
00133   into.insert(into.end(), from.begin(), from.end());
00134   return into;
00135 }

00153 template <class RAIterator1, class RAIterator2>
00154 class ScalarProduct: public binary_function<RAIterator1, RAIterator1, typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type >  {
00155  public:
00156   vector<typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type> v2;
00157   ScalarProduct(RAIterator2 start, RAIterator2 stop) :v2(start, stop){};
00158   typename iterator_traits<RAIterator1>::value_type 
00159     operator()(RAIterator1 start, RAIterator2 stop) {
00160     return scalar_product(start, stop, v2.begin());
00161   }
00162 };

00164 template <class T>
00165 class adder : public unary_function<T, void> {
00166 public:
00167   adder() : result(0) {}
00168   T result;
00169   T operator()(T x) { 
00170     T last = result;
00171     result += x; 
00172     assert(((x >= 0 && result >= last) || (x <= 0 && result <= last)) && "Possible overflow in adder<>");
00173     return result;
00174   }
00175 };

00177 template <class T>
00178 T square(T x) {
00179   return x * x;
00180 }
00181 
00182 template <class T>
00183 class square_adder : public unary_function<T, void> {
00184 public:
00185   square_adder() : result(0) {}
00186   T result;
00187   void operator()(T x) { 
00188     T last = result;
00189     result += square(x); 
00190     assert( result >= last && "Possible overflow in square_adder<>");
00191   }
00192 };

00194 template <class T>
00195 class resizer : public unary_function<T, void> {
00196 public:
00197   long size;
00198   resizer(long s) {
00199     size = s;
00200   }
00201   void operator()(T x) { x.resize(size); }
00202 };

00263 template<class OutputIterator>
00264 class NumericSequence {
00265   typedef typename iterator_traits<OutputIterator>::value_type Number;
00266 public:
00267   OutputIterator operator()(Number offset, Number increment, int size, OutputIterator result) {
00268     *result = offset; result ++;
00269     for (; result < result + size; result ++) {
00270       *result = *(result - 1) + increment;
00271     }
00272     return result;
00273   }
00274 };

00281   for (long i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00282     result.insert(start, result.end);

00284   }

00288 
00289 template<class T> 
00290 vector<T> intSequence(long size, T start = 0, T inc = 1, T mod = 0, int rep = 1) {
00291   vector <T> result;
00292   for (long i = 0; i < size/rep; i++) {
00293     for ( int j = 0; j < rep; j++) {
00294       result.push_back(mod == 0 ? start: start % mod);
00295     }
00296     start += inc;
00297   }
00298   return result;
00299 }
00300 
00301 template <class RandomAccessIterator>
00302 string join (RandomAccessIterator start, RandomAccessIterator stop, string sep = "\t") {
00303   if (start < stop) {
00304     ostringstream oneoSstream;
00305     for(; start < stop-1; start++) {
00306       oneoSstream << *start << sep;
00307     }
00308     oneoSstream << *start;
00309     return oneoSstream.str();
00310   }
00311   else return "";
00312 }

00314 template<class T> 
00315 class Print : public unary_function<T, void> {
00316  public:
00317   string sep;
00318   ostream & oneOstream;
00319   Print(ostream & ost = cout) : sep("\t"), oneOstream(ost) {}
00320   Print(string s, ostream & ost=cout): sep(s), oneOstream(ost) {
00321     //    sep = s;
00322     //oneOstream = ost;
00323   }
00324   void operator()(const T & x) { 
00325     oneOstream << x << sep;
00326   }
00327   void operator() (const T & x, ostream & ost) {
00328     ost << x << sep;
00329   }
00330   void operator()(const T & x, const string & filename) {
00331     ostream ost(filename.c_str());
00332     ost << x;
00333   }
00334 };

00336 template <class RandomAccessIterator>
00337 void shuffle(RandomAccessIterator first, RandomAccessIterator last,
00338              vector < typename iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::difference_type> permutation) {
00339   vector <typename iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::value_type> temp (first, last);
00340   typename vector<typename iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::difference_type>::difference_type i = 0;
00341   for (RandomAccessIterator current = first; current != last; current ++, i++) {
00342     *current = temp[permutation[i]]; 
00343   }
00344 }  
00345 
00346 template <class T>
00347 T RandomizedPartition(T start, T stop) {
00348 typename iterator_traits<T>::value_type pivot = 
00349     * (start + (typename iterator_traits<T>::difference_type)
00350        (((stop - start)-1) * ((rand() + 0.0)/RAND_MAX)));
00351  //--start; // keep this! will be incremented once before use. 
00352  bool first = true; /* the "first" flag is a hack as the microsoft 
00353                                            stl doesn't like decrementing start outside of 
00354                                            range in debug mode (even if not referenced). */
00355  while (true) {
00356     do {
00357       --stop;
00358     } 
00359     while (*stop > pivot);
00360     do {
00361                 if(first) 
00362                         first = false;
00363                 else 
00364                   ++start;
00365     }
00366     while (*start < pivot);
00367     if (start < stop) {
00368       swap (*start, *stop);
00369     }
00370     else {
00371       return stop;
00372     }
00373   }
00374 }
00375 
00376 template <class T>
00377 typename iterator_traits<T>::value_type
00378 RandomizedSelect(T start, T stop, 
00379                  typename iterator_traits<T>::difference_type i) {
00380   /*  vector<typename iterator_traits<T>::value_type> tmp(start,stop);
00381   sort(tmp.begin(), tmp.end());
00382   copy(start, stop, ostream_iterator<double>(cerr, " "));
00383   cerr << "\npos "<< i << " value " << tmp[i] << " size " << stop - start << endl;*/
00384   if (start == stop - 1) {
00385     return *start ;
00386   }
00387   T pivot = RandomizedPartition(start, stop);
00388   //   copy(start, stop, ostream_iterator<double>(cerr, " "));
00389   //   cerr << "\n";
00390   typename iterator_traits<T>::difference_type k = pivot - start;
00391   //  cerr << "i: " << i << " k: " << k << " pivot: " << *pivot << endl;
00392   if (i <= k) {
00393     return RandomizedSelect(start, pivot + 1, i);
00394   }
00395   else {
00396     return RandomizedSelect(pivot + 1, stop, i - k -1);
00397   }
00398 }

00401 template <class T>
00402 T next(T x) {
00403   T tmp(x);
00404   tmp++;
00405   return  tmp;
00406 }
00407 
00408 template <class T>
00409 T prev(T x) {
00410   T tmp(x);
00411   tmp--;
00412   return  tmp;
00413 }

00415 template <class RAit>
00416 class skip_iterator: public RAit {
00417  public:
00418   skip_iterator(RAit it, int skip): RAit(it), n(skip) {} 
00419   skip_iterator<RAit> operator ++() {
00420     *this += n;
00421     return *this;
00422   }
00423   skip_iterator<RAit> operator ++(int) {
00424     skip_iterator<RAit> tmp = *this;
00425     *this += n;
00426     return tmp;
00427   }
00428   skip_iterator<RAit> operator --() {
00429     *this -= n;  
00430     return *this;
00431   }
00432   skip_iterator<RAit> operator --(int) {
00433     skip_iterator<RAit> tmp = *this;
00434     *this -= n;  
00435     return tmp;
00436   }
00437   skip_iterator<RAit> operator + (long jump) {
00438     return (RAit::operator+ (n * jump));
00439   } 
00440   skip_iterator<RAit> operator - (long jump) {
00441     return (*this - n * jump);
00442   } 
00443   long operator - (skip_iterator<RAit> sub) {
00444     return (RAit(*this) - RAit(sub))/n;
00445   }
00446   private :
00447     int n;
00448 };
00449 
00450 template <class RAit>
00451 skip_iterator<RAit> make_skip_iterator(RAit it, int skip) {
00452   return (skip_iterator<RAit>(it,skip));
00453 }

00456 // for_each.  Apply a function to every element of a range.
00457 // this is my binary version. Should be in the STL to start with
00458 template <class _InputIter1, class _InputIter2, class _Function>
00459 _Function for_each(_InputIter1 __first1, _InputIter1 __last1, _InputIter2 __first2, _Function __f) {
00460   for ( ; __first1 != __last1; ++__first1, ++__first2)
00461     __f(*__first1, *__first2);
00462   return __f;
00463 }
